H0.text: which state is the richest state in nigeria. Rivers State

H1.text: which state is the richest state in nigeria. Delta State

H2.text: which state is the richest state in nigeria. Akwa Ibom State

H3.text: which state is the richest state in nigeria. Lagos State

A4.text: Delta State is one of the wealthiest states in Nigeria due to its significant oil reserves and economic activities.

A5.text: Lagos State is also considered one of the richest states in Nigeria because of its economic hub status, financial institutions, and major industries.

A6.text: Rivers State is another wealthy state in Nigeria, largely due to its substantial oil and gas production.

A7.text: Akwa Ibom State is known for its oil wealth and has been a major contributor to Nigeria's petroleum sector.

A8.text: Lagos State has the lowest incidence of extreme poverty (around 1.3% of the population against a national average of 31%) of all states in Nigeria, according to World Bank data from 2018.

A9.text: Lagos State's Gross domestic product (GDP) in 2025 is estimated to be over US$250 billion, making it the major economic centre of Nigeria.
